Some of the stimulation parameters that can be modified if no performance error is detected in an area which should be relevant to speech can be selected from the stimulation frequency, IPI, stimulation intensity, TMS interval, Picture TMS interval (PTI), pulse mode, pulse number and/or picture display time. It is preferable that when modifying stimulation parameters that only one parameter is modified at a time. Furthermore, it is preferable that parameters are altered in the order as shown in step 266 of Figure 5.

In an embodiment according to Figure 5, the first time that it is determined in step 264 that a stimulation parameter is to be modified in step 266, the stimulation frequency is increased. The amount which the stimulation frequency is increased can vary based on the remainder of the current parameters or by a predetermined amount. An example is that the first frequency increase can be5Hz and may increase to 7Hz to 10Hz. If the process continues and there it is again determined after some number of testings at step 264 that the stimulation parameters are still not adequate, then the frequency can be increased again, or the next parameter, in the present example the IPI, can be adjusted. In the present example, the chain of stimulation parameters to be adjusted is increasing the stimulation frequency, then shortening the IPI (for example by 0.5 seconds), then increasing the intensity (for example by a percentage of the subjects MT or by a predetermined amount such as lOV/m), then shortening PTI (for example by 50ms) and finally by shortening the display time of the picture (for example by 50ms). The chain can be done sequentially, i.e. the first time increasing the frequency, the second time shortening the IPI, the third time increasing intensity, the fourth time shortening PTI, the fifth time shortening display time, the sixth time increasing frequency, the seventh time shortening IPI, and so on.

The chain can also be carried out in stages where the frequency is increased a predetermined amount of times, or to a predetermined limit and then the chain moves to the next stage of shortening the IPI by a predetermined amount of times, or to a predetermined limit and so on. Although it is preferable to only make one modification at a time, when carrying out the chain in stages, it can be beneficial if the frequency begins at a certain first level, to increase it sequentially to a limit (or a predetermined number of times) and then to decrease the frequency below the limit but to a level above the first level and then to proceed by adjusting the next parameter and so on.
The chain described herein is only an example and modifying the stimulation parameters in other ways not explicitly described herein does not depart from the scope of the present invention. Once the stimulation parameters are properly set and the area of the brain that is to be mapped during that particular session is determined completed 262 then the speech mapping ends 268. At this point, the mapping data can be saved or loaded in to a hard drive in the system, for instance in a non-transitory computer readable storage medium on terminal 102 or 142. Additionally, the mapping data, with or without additional information such as the MT, speech baseline, stimulation parameters, etc., can be loaded on to an external or removable hard drive or on to a remote server. Said information can then be utilized later by the same or another system to re-map, review or otherwise utilize the data.

The present invention is not limited to the examples and embodiments disclosed herein. Numerous variations and embodiments not explicitly disclosed herein will be apparent to those of ordinary skill in the art without departing from the scope of the present invention.

claim.claim-text: A method of cognitive mapping comprising the steps of; determining a cognitive base line response from a subject in response to the presentation of a task, presenting the task to the subject again while stimulating an area of the brain with a magnetic field via a Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) coil device, comparing the subjects base line response to the task with the subjects performance during stimulation, and determining if the area of the brain stimulated is involved in the cognitive function.

A method in accordance with claim 1, further comprising the steps of; presenting the task to the subject one or more further times while correspondingly stimulating one or more further areas of the brain with a magnetic field via a TMS coil device, comparing the subjects base line response to the task with each of the subjects performances during stimulations, and determining if one or more of the areas of the brain stimulated are involved in the cognitive function.

A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims, further comprising the steps of; presenting the task to the subject while stimulating the area of the brain with a magnetic field via a TMS coil device with a first set of parameters, wherein if no performance error is detected between the subjects base line and the subjects performance during stimulation, changing at least one of the parameters of the first set of parameters, and
presenting the task to the subject while stimulating the same area of the brain with a magnetic field via a TMS coil device with the new set of parameters.

4. A method in accordance with claim 3, wherein the set of parameters are selected from the group of stimulation frequency, inter picture interval, stimulation intensity, picture-TMS interval, pulse mode, number of pulse and task display time.
5. A method in accordance with either claim 3 or 4, wherein only one parameter is changed.

6. A method in accordance with any of claims 3-5, wherein if no performance error is detected between the subjects performance during stimulation with the new set of parameters, changing at least one of the new set of parameters and presenting the task to the subject while stimulating the same area of the brain with a magnetic field via a TMS coil device with the updated new set of parameters.
7. A method in accordance with claim 6, wherein the process is repeated until it is determined that the area being stimulated is not involved in the cognitive function.
8. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims wherein the stimulated area of the brain is mapped.
9. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims wherein the TMS coil is operated in conjunction with a Navigated Brain Stimulation (NBS) system.
10. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims wherein the area of the brain which is stimulated is an area suspected of being involved in the cognitive function.
11. A method in accordance with any of claims 8-10, wherein the area of the brain which is stimulated is a specific point on the surface or within the subject's brain.
12. A method in accordance with any of claims 8-11, wherein the mapping is 3- Dimensional mapping.

13. A method in accordance with any of claims 8-12, wherein the subject's cognitive function is mapped on a model of a brain selected from a standard brain model, a brain model equivalent to the subject's or a brain model specific to the subjects.

14. A method in accordance with claim 13, wherein the subject's cognitive function is mapped on a model of the brain specific to the subject which is at least partially based on an MRI of the subject's brain.
15. A method in accordance with any of claims 8-14, wherein the area of the brain to be stimulated is selected by a portion of the system associated with the mapping.
16. A method in accordance with claim 15, wherein the area of the brain to be stimulated is selected based on the result of at least one previous stimulation.
17. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims wherein the method is used to map the cognitive function of an area of the subject's brain.

18. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims wherein determining if the area of the brain stimulated is involved in the cognitive function further comprises determining the extent to which the area of the brain is involved in the cognitive function.
19. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims wherein the cognitive function is selected from the group of speech, language, working-memory and decision-making.
20. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims wherein the task is displaying a series of images to the subject and having the subject name the images.

21. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims wherein the task is presenting a series of images, sounds, and/or questions to the subject and having the subject respond to each presentation.

22. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims wherein comparing the subject's base line response to the task with each of the subject's performances during stimulations is done automatically by a cognitive unit.
23. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims wherein the base line response is the subject's response without any stimulation.
24. A method in accordance with any of claims 1-22 wherein the base line response is a subject's early response to the task during stimulation.
25. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims wherein determining if the area of the brain stimulated is involved in the cognitive function is done automatically by a cognitive unit.
26. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims wherein more than one tasks are presented to the subject.
27. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims wherein a different task is presented to the subject for each area of the brain which is stimulated.

28. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims, further comprising the step of determining the subject's motor threshold or speech arrest threshold prior to stimulating the subject's brain via the TMS coil device.

29. A method in accordance with claim 28, wherein the TMS coil device is operated with a set of parameters, wherein the set of parameters includes the stimulation intensity of 1-110% of a subjects motor threshold or speech arrest threshold.

30. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims, wherein the TMS coil device is operated with a set of parameters, wherein the set of parameters includes a number of stimulation pulses for each stimulation between 1 and 100, preferably between 2 and 10.

31. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims, wherein the TMS coil device is operated with a set of parameters, wherein the set of parameters includes a pulse frequency between 1 and 100 Hz, preferably between 5 to 10 Hz.

32. A method in accordance with any of the preceding claims, wherein the TMS coil device is operated with a set of parameters, wherein the set of parameters includes a picture TMS interval (PTI) of 10ms to 1.5 sec, preferably between 100ms and 500ms, most preferably 300ms.
33. A system for performing the method of any of the preceding claims.
34. A computer program product having stored there on a set of computer readable instructions for causing a processor to carry out the method according to any of the preceding claims.
35. A transitory or non-transitory computer readable medium for causing a processor to carry out the method according to any of the preceding claims.

36. A system for cognitive mapping comprising; a Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) coil device, a stimulus control connected to said TMS coil device capable of causing said TMS coil device to generate a magnetic field a presentation display for presenting a task to a subject at least one terminal having one or more processors, said one or more processors being configured to perform the steps of determining, recording and/or inputting a cognitive base line response from a subject in response to the presentation of a task, presenting the task to the subject via the presentation display while stimulating an area of the brain with a magnetic field via the (TMS) coil device, comparing the subjects base line response to the task with the subjects performance during stimulation, and determining if the area of the brain stimulated is involved in the cognitive function.

37. A system in accordance with claim 36, wherein at least one or more of the processors are further configured to perform the steps of; presenting the task to the subject while stimulating the area of the brain with a magnetic field via a TMS coil device with a first set of parameters, wherein if no performance error is detected between the subjects base line and the subjects performance during stimulation, changing at least one of the parameters of the first set of parameters, and
presenting the task to the subject while stimulating the same area of the brain with a magnetic field via a TMS coil device with the new set of parameters.
38. A system in accordance with claim 37, wherein one or more of the parameters changed are changed in the stimulus control.
39. A system in accordance to any of claims 36-38, further comprising; at least one tracking device for tracking the location of the TMS coil device in relation to the subject's head.
40. A system in accordance with claim 39, further comprising one or more processors configured to perform navigated brain stimulation.
41. A system in accordance with any of claims 36-40, further comprising a device for monitoring the subject's physical response to stimulation.
42. A system in accordance with claim 41, wherein said device is an EMG.
43. A system in accordance with any of claims 36-42, further comprising a camera which is capable of recording the subjects responses to the presented tasks.
44. A system in accordance with claim 43, wherein the camera includes a microphone.

45. A system in accordance with either claim 43 or 44, wherein comparing the subjects base line response to the task with the subjects performance during stimulation includes one or more processors in a cognitive unit which are configured to compare the subjects response to a particular task recorded by said camera during a baseline determination and the subjects response recorded by said camera during stimulation.
46. A system in accordance with any of claims 43-45, wherein the feed from the camera is stored on a computer readable storage medium associated with the system.
47. A system in accordance with claim 46 wherein said computer readable storage medium is a hard drive on one or more of said terminals.
48. A system in accordance with any of claims 43-47, wherein the feed from said camera is coordinated with the stimulation applied to the subject.
49. A system in accordance with claim 48, wherein said coordination is a time-sync.
50. A system in accordance with any of claims 36-49, further comprising an operator display.

51. A system in accordance with claim 50, wherein one or more processors are configured to display on said operator display a navigation display which displays the projected 3-Dimensional magnetic field from a stimulation from the TMS coil device on a model of a brain.

52. A system in accordance with either claim 50 or claim 51, wherein one or more processors are configured to display on said operator display one or more points of the subject's brain which have been stimulated and an indication of the extent to which each location is involved in said cognitive function.
53. A method in accordance with any of claims 1-32, wherein multiple cognitive base line responses are determined prior to stimulation.

54. A method in accordance with any of claims 1-32 and 53, wherein determining one or more of the cognitive base line responses includes selecting a set of the most successful images to be displayed during future cognitive base line determinations and/or stimulation.
55. A method in accordance with claim 54, wherein said most successful images are those with at least two identical responses during the same cognitive base line determination.
56. A method in accordance with either claim 54 or 55, wherein any image which has a negative response is ineligible for use during stimulation.
57. A method in accordance with any of claims 1-32 and 53-56, wherein during base line determination the average speech onset for the subject is determined.
58. A method in accordance with any of claims 1-32 and 53-57, wherein during base line determination the normal range of speech onset for the subject is determined.

59. A method in accordance with either claim 57 or 58, wherein said determined speech onset for a subject is used in determining at least one initial parameter for stimulation and/or subsequent base line determination.
